sentences.en: An electron in the innermost orbit has the least energy.
sentences.cn: 最里面的轨道上的电子能量最低.

sentences.en: Astronauts will make a final attempt today to rescue a communications satellite from its useless orbit.
sentences.cn: 今天宇航员将会做最后一次尝试，力图把一颗通信卫星从无效的轨道上抢救下来。

sentences.en: Ground controllers will then fire the booster, sending the satellite into its proper orbit.
sentences.cn: 然后地面控制人员将会发射推进器，把卫星送入正常轨道。

sentences.en: his goal sent the fans into orbit.
sentences.cn: 他的进球使球迷们极度兴奋。

sentences.en: How many satellites have been put into orbit round the earth?
sentences.cn: 有多少颗人造卫星已送入绕地球轨道?

sentences.en: In the late 1970s Laos fell within the orbit of Vietnam and the Soviet Union.
sentences.cn: 20世纪70年代末，老挝被纳入了越南和苏联的势力范围。

sentences.en: Let's suppose that the electron at first is in the normal orbit.
sentences.cn: 让我们假设电子起初在基态轨道上.

sentences.en: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.cn: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

sentences.en: Our team has gone into orbit.
The orbit of the artificial satellite has an apogee of 200 miles from the earth.
sentences.cn: 这个人造卫星的轨道,其最远点在离地球200英里的地方.

sentences.en: The orbit of this comet intersects the orbit of the Earth.
sentences.cn: 这颗彗星的轨道与地球的轨道交叉。

sentences.en: The planet is probably in orbit around a small star.
sentences.cn: 这颗行星可能正环绕着一颗小恒星运行。

sentences.en: The satellite orbits the Earth every 48 hours.
sentences.cn: 这颗人造卫星每48小时绕地球运行一周。

sentences.en: The satellite was launched into orbit around the moon.
sentences.cn: 卫星被射入环绕月球的轨道.

sentences.en: The space rocket was launched and went into orbit.
sentences.cn: 宇宙火箭发射后进入轨道.

sentences.en: The two spacecraft will link up ( with each other ) in orbit.
sentences.cn: 两艘宇宙飞船将于轨道上 ( 互相 ) 连接.

sentences.en: They put a weather satellite into orbit round the earth.
sentences.cn: 他们把一颗气象卫星送入环绕地球的轨道.

sentences.en: Yet bigger satellites will be sent up into orbit.
sentences.cn: 更为大型的卫星将被送入轨道。
